skill.name: api-documentation
skill.description: Auto-generate comprehensive API documentation with examples, schemas, and interactive tools.
skill.summary: Auto-generate comprehensive API documentation with examples, schemas, and interactive tools.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides guidance and examples for generating API documentation. It contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or other potentially harmful capabilities. The skill consists solely of markdown documentation with code examples.

content.value_statement: Creating comprehensive API documentation is time-consuming and often gets outdated. This skill automatically generates complete API documentation with examples, schemas, and interactive tools from your code or OpenAPI specs.
actual_capabilities: Generate API reference documentation from code comments
Create interactive documentation with Swagger UI and Redoc
Export documentation in HTML, Markdown, and PDF formats
limitations: Requires existing API code or OpenAPI specification
Cannot generate documentation for undocumented code
Interactive features need web server setup

use_cases.title: Document REST APIs automatically
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive documentation from OpenAPI specs or code comments with examples and interactive try-it features.

use_cases.title: Setup developer portals
use_cases.description: Create professional API documentation sites with Swagger UI, Redoc, or custom templates for internal or external developers.

use_cases.title: Maintain up-to-date API docs
use_cases.description: Keep documentation synchronized with code changes using automated generation from JSDoc, TypeDoc, or FastAPI docstrings.

prompt_templates.title: Generate from OpenAPI
prompt_templates.scenario: You have an OpenAPI spec file
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate comprehensive API documentation from my OpenAPI specification. Include authentication guides, code examples in JavaScript, Python, and curl, error handling documentation, and setup instructions for Swagger UI.

prompt_templates.title: Document from code
prompt_templates.prompt: Create API documentation from my Express.js code with JSDoc comments. Generate a getting started guide, endpoint reference with examples, and setup instructions for interactive documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Create developer portal
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a complete developer portal
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a developer portal with API documentation, authentication guide, rate limiting policies, SDK generation, and interactive API explorer. Include multi-language examples and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Postman collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Postman collection from my API documentation with pre-configured requests, environment variables, test scripts, and documentation for each endpoint.

output_examples.input: Generate API documentation for a user management API with authentication
output: Complete API reference with all endpoints documented
Authentication guide with Bearer token examples
Code samples in JavaScript, Python, curl, and Go
Error handling documentation with status codes
Getting started tutorial for new developers

best_practices: Always include working code examples in multiple programming languages
Document authentication requirements clearly with examples
Keep documentation synchronized with API changes using automation
anti_patterns: Publishing documentation without testing all code examples
Skipping error handling and edge case documentation
Using outdated documentation tools that don't support OpenAPI 3.0

faq.question: Which documentation formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supports OpenAPI 3.0, Swagger 2.0, and can generate Markdown, HTML, PDF documentation plus Postman collections.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing code?
faq.answer: Yes, works with JSDoc comments, TypeDoc for TypeScript, and FastAPI docstrings to generate docs from existing code.

faq.question: How do I set up interactive documentation?
faq.answer: Provides setup guides for Swagger UI, Redoc, and Stoplight Elements with Express.js, FastAPI, and static hosting options.

faq.question: Is my API specification data safe?
faq.answer: This is a documentation generation tool that processes your specifications locally. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if my API changes frequently?
faq.answer: Use automated documentation generation from code comments or CI/CD pipelines to keep docs synchronized with code.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual documentation?
faq.answer: Automatic generation ensures consistency, includes all endpoints, provides interactive features, and reduces maintenance effort.
